display_title.display_title:
Argentina - Flood Protection
            Project : environmental assessment (Vol. 2) : Annexes

repnme.cdata!:
Argentina - Flood Protection Project :
            environmental assessment

subsc: Flood protection,Central government administration,Housing construction,Sub-national government administration,Other social services
trustfund:
TF037914-ARGENTINA - FLOOD PROTECTION,TF037132-ARGENTINA - FLOODPLAIN
            MANAGEMENT WORKSHOP

abstracts.cdata!:
The study area of the environmental
            assessment of the Flood Protection Project included
            Paraguay, Parana, and Uruguay river's floodplains.
            This is a macrosystem containing diverse subsystems
            differing in their structure and function.  Its ecological
            stability depends on the conservation of such heterogeneity.
            Man's activities lead to environmental simplification,
            and a deterioration of its abiotic and biotic components.
            In most of the area man has extended his range to the
            floodplain.  The report suggests that within the anthropic
            environment the potential negative impacts from the
            structure for protection against floods should be less
            significant than those caused by floods when these
            structures are lacking.  They evaluated the adequacy of
            these structures considering those currently existent and
            those programmed for the near future, a special point to be
            dealt with in order to recommend future trends of urban
            expansion.  The main objectives of this report are directed
            to describe the most relevant environmental features of
            Paraguay, Parana, and Uruguay rivers flood plains, regarding
            their abiotic, biotic and anthropic components, and their
            conformity with the pulsatile regime.  The obtained basic
            information has been used to assess those potential
            environmental impacts that would be produced by the flood
            control projects.
